intro: Homalobus grallator, commonly known as the climbing bignay, is a woody vine native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by yellow-orange berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
